source_sentence: 阿闍世王授決經
translation: Sutra on the Granting of Decisions by King Ajātaśatru

source_sentence: 西晉沙門釋法炬譯
translation: Translated by the Śākyamuni Shi Farō

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在羅閱祇國耆闍崛山中。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the Gṛdhrakūṭa mountains of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 時阿闍世王請佛，飯食已訖，佛還祇洹。
translation: The king of Ajātaśatru invited the Buddha, and after he had finished his meal, he returned to Qipan.

source_sentence: 王與祇婆議曰：「今日請佛，佛飯已竟，更復所宜？」
translation: The king and Geeta discussed the matter, saying, "After the Buddha has finished his meal, what else should he do?"

source_sentence: 祇婆言：「惟多然燈也。」
translation: The jīva said, "We are the lamp of Bṛhatphala."

source_sentence: 於是王乃勅具百斛麻油膏，從宮門至祇洹精舍。
translation: The king then ordered him to bring a hundred tubs of hemp-seed oil and cream from the palace gate to the Jetavana monastery.

source_sentence: 時有貧窮老母，常有至心欲供養佛而無資財，見王作此功德乃更感激，行乞得兩錢，以至麻油家買膏。
translation: Seeing this merit from the king, she became even more grateful and begged for two coins to go to the sesame oil vendor to buy ointment.

source_sentence: 膏主曰：「母人大貧窮，乞得兩錢，何不買食以自連繼，用此膏為？」
translation: The person who administered the ointment said, "She's very poor, so why wouldn't she buy food for herself and continue using this ointment if she had just begged for two coins?"

source_sentence: 母曰：「我聞佛生難值，百劫一遇。
translation: Mother said, "I've heard that buddhas are hard to come by in their lifetime and are encountered once every hundred eons.

source_sentence: 我幸逢佛世而無供養，今日見王作大功德，巍巍無量激起我意，雖實貧窮故欲然一燈，為後世根本者也。」
translation: I was fortunate enough to meet the Buddha in his lifetime but had no offerings, so today I saw the king's great merit, which is so lofty and immeasurable that it aroused my desire. Although I'm really poor, I want to preserve this lamp as a foundation for future generations."

source_sentence: 於是膏主知其至意，與兩錢膏應得二合，特益三合凡得五合。
translation: Knowing his intentions, the donor then gave him two coins of ointment that should have been two coins, and three coins that should have been five coins.

source_sentence: 母則往，當佛前然之。
translation: The mother then went and gave it to him when he was in front of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 心計此膏不足半夕，乃自誓言：「若我後世得道如佛，膏當通夕光明不消。」
translation: Thinking that the anointing would last less than half a night, she vowed to herself, "If I attain Buddhahood in the afterlife, the anointing will last through the night and not fade away."

source_sentence: 作禮而去。
translation: He paid homage and departed.

source_sentence: 王所然燈或滅、或盡，雖有人侍恒不周匝；老母所然一燈，光明特朗，殊勝諸燈通夕不滅，膏又不盡。
translation: The king's lamp sometimes went out or ran out, and even though it was attended by someone, it never went around, but the one lamp that the old mother turned on had an especially bright light that was superior to all the other lamps and didn't go out all night, and the anointing didn't run out.

source_sentence: 至明朝旦，母復來前頭面作禮，叉手却住。
translation: When morning came and the sun rose, the mother again came forward, paid homage with her head and face, and withdrew with her palms together.

source_sentence: 佛告目連：「天今已曉，可滅諸燈。」
translation: The Buddha told Maudgalyāyana, "Now that it's dawn, you can extinguish the lamps."

source_sentence: 目連承教，以次滅諸燈，燈皆已滅，惟此母一燈三滅不滅，便舉袈裟以扇之，燈光益明；乃以威神引隨藍風以次吹燈，老母燈更盛猛，乃上照梵天，傍照三千世界悉見其光。
translation: Moulian obeyed his teaching and extinguished the lamps in turn, but this mother's one lamp that had been extinguished three times didn't go out. He then raised his robe and fanned it, and the lamp's light grew brighter.

source_sentence: 佛告目連：「止！
translation: The Buddha told Maudgalyāyana, "Stop!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Stop!

source_sentence: 此當來佛之光明功德，非汝威神所毀滅。
translation: This bright attribute of a future Buddha isn't something your authority and soul would disparage.

source_sentence: 此母宿命供養百八十億佛已，從前佛受決，務以經法教授開化人民，未暇修檀，故今貧窮無有財寶。
translation: After making offerings to 18 billion buddhas in her previous life, this mother received a decision from a previous buddha to teach the people with sūtras and teachings, but she didn't have time to cultivate giving, so now she's poor and doesn't have any possessions.

source_sentence: 却後三十劫，功德成滿當得作佛，號曰須彌燈光如來、至真，世界無有日月，人民身中皆有大光，宮室眾寶光明相照如忉利天上。」
translation: Yet, in the next 30 eons, when she has completed her merit, she will become a buddha, to be called Sumeru Dōkyō Tathāgata, the supreme truth, a world without sun and moon, a great light in the bodies of the people, and a palace full of treasures shining brightly as in the Heaven of the Thirty-three."

source_sentence: 老母聞決歡喜，即時輕舉身昇虛空，去地百八十丈，來下頭面作禮而去。
translation: The old mother rejoiced when she heard this, and immediately lifted herself up into the sky, going 180 feet below the ground, bowing with her head and face, and departing.

source_sentence: 王聞之，問祇婆曰：「我作功德巍巍如此，而佛不與我決；此母然一燈便受決。
translation: When the king heard this, he asked Geeta, "I've made such towering achievements, and the Buddha didn't give me a decision; yet this mother accepted the decision with a single lamp.

source_sentence: 何以爾也？」
translation: Why is that?"

source_sentence: 祇婆曰：「王所作雖多，心不專一，不如此母注心於佛也。」
translation: The guard said, "Although the king does many things, his mind isn't focused on one thing; it's not like this mother to devote her mind to the Buddha."

source_sentence: 乃更往請佛。
translation: He then went back to the Buddha and invited him.

source_sentence: 宿勅諸園監，各令晨採好華，早送入宮至中。
translation: He ordered the garden supervisors to gather flowers in the morning and bring them into the palace in the morning.

source_sentence: 佛便晨出祇洹，徐徐緩行，隨道為人民說法，投日中至宮。
translation: The Buddha then left Jetavana in the morning, traveled slowly and effortlessly, taught the people in the path, and arrived at the palace in the middle of the sun.

source_sentence: 有一園監持華適出園巷，正與佛會於大道之衢，聞佛說經一心歡喜，即以所持華悉散佛上，花皆住於空中當佛頭上。
translation: One of the garden supervisors was carrying flowers and was about to leave the garden lane and meet the Buddha on the main street. When he heard the Buddha teach the sūtras, he rejoiced with joy and immediately scattered all the flowers he was carrying on top of the Buddha, and they all stayed in the air above the Buddha's head.

source_sentence: 佛即授決曰：「汝已供養九十億佛，却後百四十劫，汝當為佛，號曰覺華如來。」
translation: The Buddha then gave them a decision, saying, "You have made offerings to nine billion buddhas, but in the next 10,400 eons, you will become a buddha and be called the Kakuda Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 其人歡喜，即時輕舉身昇虛空，來下作禮畢，即更自念：「我王為人性大嚴急，故宿勅我齋戒將華，當以供佛，而我悉自以上佛，空手而往，必當殺我。」
translation: That man rejoiced and immediately lifted himself up into the sky, saluted him, and then thought to himself, "My king is so anxious about the great strictness of humanity that he's asked me to observe precepts and put flowers on offerings to the Buddha from time to time.

source_sentence: 便徑歸家，置空華箱於戶外，入告婦言：「我朝來未食，王今當殺我，急為具食。」
translation: He then went home, placed the empty flower box outside, and went in to tell the woman, "I haven't eaten since morning, but the king will kill me now, so he'll make a meal for me."

source_sentence: 婦聞大惶，懅曰：「王何故相殺？」
translation: The woman was terrified when she heard that, and she was frightened, saying, "Why is the king killing each other?"

source_sentence: 便為婦本末說之。
translation: He then explained the whole story for the woman.

source_sentence: 婦即出，至竈下具食，天帝釋便以天華滿空箱中。
translation: The woman then went out and prepared a meal under the urn, and Indra then filled the empty box with celestial flowers.

source_sentence: 婦持食還，見戶外箱中華滿如故，光色非凡，即以告夫。
translation: When the woman returned with the food, she saw the box outside her home full of flowers as before, and its appearance was extraordinary.

source_sentence: 夫出戶視，知是天花，心大歡喜，止不復食便持華入。
translation: The husband went out to look at it and knew it was a smallpox. He was overjoyed and entered with the flowers after stopping short of eating again.

source_sentence: 王適出迎佛，道與王相逢。
translation: The king then went out to greet the Buddha, and the Way met the king.

source_sentence: 王見華大好，世間希有，即問監曰：「我園中大有此好華乃爾，而汝前後不送上，汝罪應死，寧知之不？」
translation: Seeing that the flower was so beautiful, so rare in the world, the king asked the superintendent, "There are so many of these beautiful flowers in my garden, and you didn't send them up before or after, you deserve to die, don't you?"

source_sentence: 監曰：「大王！
translation: The superintendent said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 園中無有此華。
translation: This kind of flower doesn't exist in the garden.

source_sentence: 臣朝早將園華道路逢佛，不勝歡喜，盡以上佛，即授與我決。
translation: In the morning, I met the Buddha on the road with the flowers in the garden. I was overjoyed and went up to the Buddha as far as I could, and he gave me the decision.

source_sentence: 知當殺故，過家索食，比其頃出視空箱中，復見此華；必是天華，非園所有。
translation: Knowing that I would be killed, I went home to ask for food, and then I went out to look in the empty box and saw this flower again; it must be a celestial flower, not one from the garden.

source_sentence: 今我生既卑賤，為王守園，拘制縣官不得行道；一已授決，正爾而死，必生天上，十方佛前無所拘制，可得恣意行道。
translation: Now, I was born lowly, and I was guarding the garden for the king, so I was restrained by the magistrates from practicing the path. Once I've been given the decision, I will surely be born in heaven and have no restraints before the buddhas of the ten directions, so I can practice the path at will.

source_sentence: 王若相殺，我無所在也。」
translation: If the king kills each other, there's no place for me."

source_sentence: 王聞授決，便生慚怖，肅然毛竪，即起作禮，長跪懺悔。
translation: When the king heard about the verdict, he became ashamed and frightened, and his hair stood on end as he stood up, paid homage, and knelt down long enough to repent.

source_sentence: 佛至宮，飯食已訖，呪願而去。
translation: When the Buddha arrived at the palace, he finished his meal and left with a curse and a vow.

source_sentence: 王復問祇婆曰：「我前請佛，而老母受決；今日設福，而園監受決；我獨何故初無所獲？
translation: The king then asked Geeta, "I asked the Buddha before, and my elderly mother received the verdict; today, I've set up a blessing, and the park superintendent received the verdict; why didn't I alone receive anything in the first place?

source_sentence: 心甚於悒，當復宜作何等功德耶？」
translation: What further merit would it be appropriate to undertake, given that your mind is so worried?"

source_sentence: 祇婆曰：「王雖頻日設福，但用國藏之財，使人民之力，心或貢高、意或瞋恚，故未得決。
translation: The guard said, "Although the king often designates merit, he uses the wealth of his country's treasury and the power of his people, but his mind may be arrogant and his thoughts may be angry, so he hasn't yet attained resolution.

source_sentence: 今宜割損身中自供之具，并脫瓔珞七寶珠環以作寶華，當與夫人、太子併力合掌，自就功勤一心上佛，佛照王至誠必得決也。」
translation: Now, it would be wise to cut off the articles of self-offering from your body, take off your diadem and seven-jewel beads and rings, and make them into a jeweled flower.

source_sentence: 於是王減徹廚膳晝夜齋戒，脫身上諸寶，合聚諸師曰前作華，王及夫人、太子皆自著手，至九十日所作悉成，勅外駕當往上佛。
translation: The king then reduced the amount of food he cooked, observed precepts day and night, stripped off the treasures on his body, and gathered them together with the masters to make flowers, and the king, his wife, and the crown prince put their hands on them.

source_sentence: 傍臣白言：「聞佛前到鳩夷那竭國，已般泥洹也。」
translation: The ministers nearby said, "I heard that the Buddha had arrived in Kauśinagara and had already parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 王聞心大悲號，涕淚哽咽曰：「我故至心手作此華，佛雖般泥洹，我故當齎詣耆闍崛山，以上佛坐處，展馳我意也。」
translation: The king's heart was filled with compassion when he heard that, and he burst into tears and sobbed, saying, "That's why I made this flower with my whole heart, and even though the Buddha has passed beyond nirvāṇa, I'll take it up to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa and go up to where the Buddha is sitting to carry out my intention."

source_sentence: 祇婆曰：「佛者，無身亦無泥洹，亦不常住無滅無在；惟至心者為得見佛，佛雖在世間，無至心者為不見佛，大王至誠乃爾，佛雖般泥洹，往必見佛。」
translation: The guard said, "A Buddha has no body, no nirvāṇa, and doesn't abide or cease or exist; only those who have the utmost mind can see the Buddha, and although the Buddha is here in the world, those without the utmost mind don't see the Buddha; thus, maharaja, with utmost sincerity, even though the Buddha is in nirvāṇa, you will surely go and see him."

source_sentence: 便至耆闍崛山中，見佛且悲且喜，垂淚而進，頭面作禮，以七寶華前散佛上，華皆住空中化成寶蓋正當佛上，佛便授與王決曰：「却後八萬劫，劫名喜觀，王當為佛，佛號淨其所部如來，剎土名華王，時人民壽四十小劫。」
translation: He went to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa and saw the Buddha with pity and joy. He saluted him with his head and face, scattered seven-jewel flowers on top of him, and they all stayed in the air and turned into jeweled canopies that were placed right on top of the Buddha. The Buddha then gave the king a decision, saying, "But for the next 80,000 eons, the eons will be called joyful contemplation, and the king will become a buddha, a tathāgata whose name is Puruṣapura, a buddha whose land is called Flower King, and whose people will live for 40 little eons."

source_sentence: 阿闍世王太子，名旃陀和利，時年八歲，見父授決甚大歡喜，即脫身上眾寶以散佛上曰：「願淨其所部作佛時，我作金輪聖王得供養佛，佛般泥洹後，我當承續為佛。」
translation: When he was eight years old, the crown prince of Ajātaśatru named Candraprabha was overjoyed at the decision his father had given him, so he took off his body and scattered the treasures on top of the Buddha, saying, "May I become a golden-wheeled sage king and be able to support the Buddha when I purify my section and become a Buddha, and I will continue to be a Buddha after the Buddha's nirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 其所散寶，化為交露帳正覆佛上。
translation: The treasure he scattered was transformed into a jeweled canopy that was placed directly over the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「必如汝願，王為佛時必當作金輪聖王，壽終便上生兜率天上，壽盡便下作佛，在藥王剎土教授，佛號栴檀，人民壽命國土所有，皆如淨其所部。」
translation: The Buddha said, "As you wish, the king will surely be a golden-wheeled sage king when he becomes a buddha, and when his life span is up, he'll be born up in Tuṣita Heaven, and when it's up, he'll descend and become a buddha, teaching in the buddha land of the Medicine King, where the buddha's name is Sandalwood and the people's lives and the land's possessions are all as they are in the Pure Land."

source_sentence: 佛時授決適竟，王及旃陀和利前為佛作禮，便[火*霍]然不見佛所在。
translation: When the Buddha had finished giving his prediction, the king and Candraprabha paid homage to him, and then [fire*ho] disappeared.

source_sentence: 阿闍世王授決經
translation: Sutra on the King Ajātaśatru's Verdict
